title: Black's picturesque tourist of Scotland.
snippet: The Loch o' the Lowes is a small lake of a somewhat bleak aspect, formed by the Yarrow after a short course ; and Chapelhope, on the left, is where Hogg has laid the principal scenes of his " Brownie of Bodsbeck."

title: Spare hours...
author: Brown, John
snippet: * The native word for hollows in the hills : thus, Dryhope, Games- hope, Chapelhope, etc.

title: Spare hours.
author: Brown, John
